muunads

Interface Monad<A>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IO, Just, Maybe, Nothing, STMAction

    public interface Monad<A>

    A Monad of type T.

    Unlike in Haskell, I think there is no need for a `return` function in the Monad typeclass. Only bind(Function) is enough.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <C extends Monad<B>,B>
      C      		 bind(java.util.function.Function<A,C> fromAToMonadOfB)
      Binds or shoves a Monad M a into the function (f: a -> M b) to produce a new Monad (M b).
      A unwrap()
      Unwraps the Monad and returns the contents of the Monad.

    • Method Detail

      • bind

        <C extends Monad<B>,B> C bind(java.util.function.Function<A,C> fromAToMonadOfB)
        Binds or shoves a Monad M a into the function (f: a -> M b) to produce a new Monad (M b).

        The bind method of a monad allows for chaining or composition.

        Similar to Haskell's (>>=) :: M a -> (a -> M b) -> M b

        Parameters:
        fromAToMonadOfB - A function that takes something of type A and returns a Monad of type B, f :: a -> M b
        Returns:
        The result, Monad of type B, Monad<B>

      • unwrap

        A unwrap()

        Unwraps the Monad and returns the contents of the Monad.

        Returns:
        The contents of the Monad.
